A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Nothing to see here. There’s no way people actually think there is an original story line here. Kylo\, Rey and Snoke’s scene is straight out of Return of the Jedi but with zero build up or pay off. Not one of these characters was built up so the audience can not care about anyone. And the one we already do care about? Oh don’t worry. They tear Luke Skywalker off of his lofty Jedi pedestal and degrade him all the way back to being a whiny weak child again. Which is even more off putting in the body of one of the galaxy’s most powerful Jedi Knights. TFA was *OK* the second time I watched it. Not original but at least promised potential character building in the next movie. This director made sure to destroy all hope. Will not be watching episode IX in theaters.
